channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why more frequent cold blasts could be coming from global warming
item.description: Frigid air that normally stays trapped in the Arctic has escaped, plunging deep into the United States for an extended visit that is expected to provo...

item.title: 2 bodies found in JetBlue plane's landing gear compartment at a Florida airport
item.description: The bodies were located in the wheel well area at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport. It's the second time over the past month that a bod...

item.title: Can Ghana's new president meet the voters' high expectations?
item.description: John Mahama was elected on his pledges to solve the economic crisis but won't find it easy, analysts say.

item.title: 11 Yemeni detainees transferred from Guantánamo Bay to Oman
item.description: The Pentagon says the military has just transported 11 Yemeni detainees from Guantánamo Bay back to the Middle East. The mission is part of President ...

item.title: Trump Jr arrives in Greenland after dad says US should own the territory
item.description: The president-elect has said Greenland "will benefit tremendously if, and when, it becomes part of our nation".

item.title: They were going to be doctors. Instead, they had to dodge bombs and flee war
item.description: The war in Sudan has taken a toll on the medical profession. Health workers have fled the country, and those seeking to complete their medical educati...

item.title: The polar vortex brings its bitter cold to the Southern US
Pentagon reaches historic settlement with LGBTQ+ veterans
item.description: The Pentagon has reached a historic legal settlement with more than 35,000 LGBTQ+ veterans that would create "new and simpler processes to obtain upda...

item.title: Dec 7: CBS News 24/7, 10am ET
item.description: Two people were found dead in a JetBlue plane's landing gear after it arrived in Florida; At least 126 killed in Tibet earthquake.

item.title: New rules will ban medical debt from your credit report
item.description: The move, which comes less than two weeks before President-elect Donald Trump is set to take office, represents a challenge to the new administration.

item.title: Facebook and Instagram get rid of fact checkers
item.description: Meta says its platforms will instead rely on "community notes" from its users, an approach pioneered by X.

item.title: French far-right politician Jean-Marie Le Pen dies at 96
item.description: Le Pen - an unrepentant extremist on race, gender and immigration - founded the far-right National Front in 1972.

item.title: Ros Atkins on...Elon Musk's political interventions
item.description: The BBC's Analysis Editor looks at Elon Musk's involvement in politics outside the US.

item.title: In a workforce transformed by war, Ukrainian women are now working in coal mines
item.description: War has changed Ukraine's workforce, especially in heavy industry and mining. With men conscripted to fight the war against Russia, women have started...

item.title: Nvidia stocks soar after GeForce RTX 50 series debuts at CES
item.description: Chipmaker Nvidia shares surge after founder Jensen Huang unveils next generation of AI for gamers at CES 2025.

item.title: McDonald's McValue menu is here. Here is what's newly offered..
item.description: McDonald's is kicking off 2025 with more ways for customers to save, including meal deals and digital discounts.

item.title: Jean-Marie Le Pen, French fiery far-right leader, dies at 96
item.description: Le Pen was convicted numerous times of antisemitism, discrimination and inciting racial violence. But the nativist ideas that propelled his popularity...

item.title: Jimmy Carter on his way back to Washington, where he remained an outsider
